content: My wife & I were discussing this question the other night, when did we know the other was the right one? I told her it was New Year's Eve 1989. We had oly been dating since April '89 & we were at a freind's house for N. Y.'s Eve. One of the guys there was started to get drunk & obnoxious(why is there always one of these types?). He made the unfortunate comment of saying the Irish are a bunch of pigs! My wife is Irish, from County Cork. It was on. My wife asked what he had just said. He, stupidly repeated it. Fast as lightening she swung, connected & left him with a black eye! He was tossed out & Jeane was the hit of the party(& soon known as someone not to be trifled with!). Then the next day, she was feeling really ashamed & thought I was going to break-up. I said,"what are you kidding me, a beautiful woman who can watch my back?!? You're a keeper!" This August will be 19 years. How about you guys care to share about your better half?

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: My wife and I met in a High School Youth Group. She was a few years younger than I, and when I joined the service, she was still in HS. The youth group did a weekend trip to Marriott's Great America, in Gurney, Ill. her junior year. I was stationed at Glakes, Ill. at the time, and camped with the youth group. I remeber Sunday morning, we both got up really early, and sat on teh top of a small sand dune, and talked quietly as the sun rose over Lake Michigan. I knew right then, that it just felt "right". I propoesd to her when I got back from Japan ( a little over 2 years on the U.S.S.Blue Ridge), but she had started to see some one else. I let it go, but thought of her often. It was 13 years later, that I got a letter from her. we started talking, and then seeing each other. We were married the following April, and in one week, it will be 13 years, for us!! She was worth the wait!!!
reply: My wife and I met in a High School Youth Group. She was a few years younger than I, and when I joined the service, she was still in HS. It was 13 years later, that I got a letter from her. we started talking, and then seeing each other. We were married the following April, and in one week, it will be 13 years, for us!! She was worth the wait!!!
title: When did you know she was the one?

content: My wife and I worked in the kitchen of a local hospital. We knew each other for a few years, but never dated. Years later she told me she actually DIDN'T like me back then. It wasn't until after I got out of the service that we started dating. A few months later we were engaged. Married in July of 1984 and will be celebrating our 25th.!

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: When we both woke up after the one-night stand and began to talk. I'm not kidding. That's when it happened. It may not be the most classically romantic of situations, but I can't think of a more pleasent memory than that morning after with both of us naked and giggling like the kids we were (she a month past 18, me 19). September 1983 to present. Throughout a full career in the military, enlisted and officer, four kids and beyond. Sullivan013
reply: When we both woke up after the one-night stand and began to talk. I'm not kidding. That's when it happened. September 1983 to present. Throughout a full career in the military, enlisted and officer, four kids and beyond. Sullivan013
title: When did you know she was the one?

content: DH and I agree that after about the first week of us talking we knew. There was never a question of "if" we would get married, it was only when. 2 years on April 21st with a 6 month old boy

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: Well I have to admit, I am not very romantic and I have never met anyone and thought he is the one. I met my dh when I was 28 and we married 3 years later. We have been together for 21 years. We were compatible, and really liked and enjoyed each others company. We have a lot of fun together and for me he is the best friend and husband I could ever of imagined. My friend went to Scotland for a vacation, and I guess you just don't mess with Scottish men or women LOL. He got drunk in a pub, couldn't handle the whiskey or whatever he was drinking and some woman gave him 2 black eyes.
reply: Well I have to admit, I am not very romantic and I have never met anyone and thought he is the one. I met my dh when I was 28 and we married 3 years later. We have been together for 21 years. title: When did you know she was the one?

content: It took me a while, I was not ready for a serious relationship. Lora said she knew the first time we met. She called me two nights after our first date, she wondered if if I'd like to out again. I told her I hadn't thought about. Needless to say... we had a second date. From there, it was history. She wined me and dined me, no kidding, she had me over her parents home. She cooked dinner, sometimes her mom cooked dinner. She took me to dinner at a nice restaurant in San Francisco. Not to give yall the wrong idea, I did take her out for drinks and dinner sometimes. Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
reply: It took me a while, I was not ready for a serious relationship. Lora said she knew the first time we met. Not to give yall the wrong idea, I did take her out for drinks and dinner sometimes. Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
title: When did you know she was the one?

content: We met on September 2nd 1960 on “not a date” but as tag-a-longs so that my roommate and her roommate could go on their first date. It was strictly a coke and hamburger thing – maybe an hour-and-a-half-altogether. I didn’t like her very much, she was very pretty and very smart she was very quiet. And I was “chairman of the board for BFL international.” And, I intended to hold that position for life. The girls were stationed at Charleston AFB. My buddy and I were stationed at Dover AFB and had only been TDY to CAFB for three days. Anyway, I saw her the next morning at breakfast in the dinning hall. I asked could I set with her, she said, with a shrug, sure. It was just breakfast and very little talk. By the time I left the table, I knew that she was the one for me. 27 days later we were married. It took me three weeks for me to convince her that she should marry me. That was 48+ years ago. I’m happier and more in love with her now than I ever dreamed possible. I can’t even conceive life with out her. I resigned from BFL after the breakfast meeting. I’m assuming everyone has heard of BLF. God and the soldier, All men adore, In time of trouble, And no more; For when war is over, And all things righted, God is neglected - The old soldier slighted. Founding Member Original DVG & Proud Member, Rupterd Duck/Derelict Veterans

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: My wife said she knew I was the right one when we met on our first date. I knew she was right when she asked me to stay over at her house the next weekend. I was 29 and she was 23. We celebrated our 25th this past Jan. BTW, our first date was a blind date. And she was the youngest of 7 girls. Their father was the county sheriff at the time.

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: My wife told me that she knew I was going to be the one when she first saw me standing next to a tall tree, with the Sun setting in the background, I was in Military Uniform with bloused spit shined boots, a light tan colored uniform on with silver jump wings on my chest that were blinding her when the Sun hit them, a tall, dark, Vietnam Tanned, handsome man of 19 who when you looked into his distant eyes could see that he meant business as he began to peeeee. That was 41 years ago and I'm still that same man.

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: Well I am obviously not one to suggest I am an expert on marriage....3 divorces. However, the one I've been with for the past 6 months (girlfriend, not wife) is looking pretty good. How did I know she just might be #4 if she plays her cards right? Well, I guess it was the night we had watched a Red Sox game, it ended, then we started watching something else. During a commercial she asked if she could turn it. To what?......Red Sox highlights. "You're cooooool!" I told her. Also, I thought I'd hang around her some more so I can go to her next high school reunion....she graduated HS with Conan O'Brien. Actually, she's way too cool and laid back for me to wreck this one, hopefully. Don

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: Well, I tied Mystical's long black braided pig-tails to the hymnal rack on the back of her bench in Sunday Meeting back in 1956 - and she let out a screech that woke up her father, one of the guys in suits and ties seated up behind the podium - - He for ever hated my guts, but we got married 13 years later at 19 - - So you might say, it was a match made in Heaven! Our 40th Anniversary comes September Wandering and Wondering

Our 40th Anniversary comes September Wandering and Wondering

content: UMMMM I knew I was convince she was the one once her Dad loaded the shotgun Been there, Done that and I have the shots to prove it.

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: Some girl at my brothers bar had a crush on me. So she brought her freind to make sure she approved. A Long haired blonde knockout, so I started dateing her, she was a few months shy of 18, I was going on 24. She wouldn't allow me to pick her up so i'd send a younger cousin. Her mother found out an forbid me to date her daughter wrong move on her part. After 23 yrs of marriage, I shoullda listened to her mother.

content: We met on September 2nd 1960 on “not a date” but as tag-a-longs so that my roommate and her roommate could go on their first date. It was strictly a coke and hamburger thing – maybe an hour-and-a-half-altogether. I didn’t like her very much, she was very pretty and very smart she was very quiet. And I was “chairman of the board for BFL international.” And, I intended to hold that position for life. The girls were stationed at Charleston AFB. My buddy and I were stationed at Dover AFB and had only been TDY to CAFB for three days. Anyway, I saw her the next morning at breakfast in the dinning hall. I asked could I set with her, she said, with a shrug, sure. It was just breakfast and very little talk. By the time I left the table, I knew that she was the one for me. 27 days later we were married. It took me three weeks for me to convince her that she should marry me. That was 48+ years ago. I’m happier and more in love with her now than I ever dreamed possible. I can’t even conceive life with out her. I resigned from BFL after the breakfast meeting. I’m assuming everyone has heard of BLF. God and the soldier, All men adore, In time of trouble, And no more; For when war is over, And all things righted, God is neglected - The old soldier slighted. Founding Member Original DVG & Proud Member, Rupterd Duck/Derelict Veterans

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: My wife said she knew I was the right one when we met on our first date. I knew she was right when she asked me to stay over at her house the next weekend. I was 29 and she was 23. We celebrated our 25th this past Jan. BTW, our first date was a blind date. And she was the youngest of 7 girls. Their father was the county sheriff at the time.

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: My wife told me that she knew I was going to be the one when she first saw me standing next to a tall tree, with the Sun setting in the background, I was in Military Uniform with bloused spit shined boots, a light tan colored uniform on with silver jump wings on my chest that were blinding her when the Sun hit them, a tall, dark, Vietnam Tanned, handsome man of 19 who when you looked into his distant eyes could see that he meant business as he began to peeeee. That was 41 years ago and I'm still that same man.

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: Well I am obviously not one to suggest I am an expert on marriage....3 divorces. However, the one I've been with for the past 6 months (girlfriend, not wife) is looking pretty good. How did I know she just might be #4 if she plays her cards right? Well, I guess it was the night we had watched a Red Sox game, it ended, then we started watching something else. During a commercial she asked if she could turn it. To what?......Red Sox highlights. "You're cooooool!" I told her. Also, I thought I'd hang around her some more so I can go to her next high school reunion....she graduated HS with Conan O'Brien. Actually, she's way too cool and laid back for me to wreck this one, hopefully. Don

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: Well, I tied Mystical's long black braided pig-tails to the hymnal rack on the back of her bench in Sunday Meeting back in 1956 - and she let out a screech that woke up her father, one of the guys in suits and ties seated up behind the podium - - He for ever hated my guts, but we got married 13 years later at 19 - - So you might say, it was a match made in Heaven! Our 40th Anniversary comes September Wandering and Wondering

Our 40th Anniversary comes September Wandering and Wondering

content: UMMMM I knew I was convince she was the one once her Dad loaded the shotgun Been there, Done that and I have the shots to prove it.

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: Some girl at my brothers bar had a crush on me. So she brought her freind to make sure she approved. A Long haired blonde knockout, so I started dateing her, she was a few months shy of 18, I was going on 24. She wouldn't allow me to pick her up so i'd send a younger cousin. Her mother found out an forbid me to date her daughter wrong move on her part. After 23 yrs of marriage, I shoullda listened to her mother.

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: My wife & I were discussing this question the other night, when did we know the other was the right one? I told her it was New Year's Eve 1989. We had oly been dating since April '89 & we were at a freind's house for N. Y.'s Eve. One of the guys there was started to get drunk & obnoxious(why is there always one of these types?). He made the unfortunate comment of saying the Irish are a bunch of pigs! My wife is Irish, from County Cork. It was on. My wife asked what he had just said. He, stupidly repeated it. Fast as lightening she swung, connected & left him with a black eye! He was tossed out & Jeane was the hit of the party(& soon known as someone not to be trifled with!). Then the next day, she was feeling really ashamed & thought I was going to break-up. I said,"what are you kidding me, a beautiful woman who can watch my back?!? You're a keeper!" This August will be 19 years. How about you guys care to share about your better half?

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: My wife and I met in a High School Youth Group. She was a few years younger than I, and when I joined the service, she was still in HS. The youth group did a weekend trip to Marriott's Great America, in Gurney, Ill. her junior year. I was stationed at Glakes, Ill. at the time, and camped with the youth group. I remeber Sunday morning, we both got up really early, and sat on teh top of a small sand dune, and talked quietly as the sun rose over Lake Michigan. I knew right then, that it just felt "right". I propoesd to her when I got back from Japan ( a little over 2 years on the U.S.S.Blue Ridge), but she had started to see some one else. I let it go, but thought of her often. It was 13 years later, that I got a letter from her. we started talking, and then seeing each other. We were married the following April, and in one week, it will be 13 years, for us!! She was worth the wait!!!

She was worth the wait!!!
title: When did you know she was the one?

content: My wife and I worked in the kitchen of a local hospital. We knew each other for a few years, but never dated. Years later she told me she actually DIDN'T like me back then. It wasn't until after I got out of the service that we started dating. A few months later we were engaged. Married in July of 1984 and will be celebrating our 25th.!

content: quote: When did you know she was the one? Just as soon as she told me she was. Now we have two great boys (13 & 15) and this year it'll be 17 years!

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: When we both woke up after the one-night stand and began to talk. I'm not kidding. That's when it happened. It may not be the most classically romantic of situations, but I can't think of a more pleasent memory than that morning after with both of us naked and giggling like the kids we were (she a month past 18, me 19). September 1983 to present. Throughout a full career in the military, enlisted and officer, four kids and beyond. Sullivan013

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: DH and I agree that after about the first week of us talking we knew. There was never a question of "if" we would get married, it was only when. 2 years on April 21st with a 6 month old boy

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: Well I have to admit, I am not very romantic and I have never met anyone and thought he is the one. I met my dh when I was 28 and we married 3 years later. We have been together for 21 years. We were compatible, and really liked and enjoyed each others company. We have a lot of fun together and for me he is the best friend and husband I could ever of imagined. My friend went to Scotland for a vacation, and I guess you just don't mess with Scottish men or women LOL. He got drunk in a pub, couldn't handle the whiskey or whatever he was drinking and some woman gave him 2 black eyes.

title: When did you know she was the one?

content: It took me a while, I was not ready for a serious relationship. Lora said she knew the first time we met. She called me two nights after our first date, she wondered if if I'd like to out again. I told her I hadn't thought about. Needless to say... we had a second date. From there, it was history. She wined me and dined me, no kidding, she had me over her parents home. She cooked dinner, sometimes her mom cooked dinner. She took me to dinner at a nice restaurant in San Francisco. Not to give yall the wrong idea, I did take her out for drinks and dinner sometimes. Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

content: Well, I tied Mystical's long black braided pig-tails to the hymnal rack on the back of her bench in Sunday Meeting back in 1956 - and she let out a screech that woke up her father, one of the guys in suits and ties seated up behind the podium - - He for ever hated my guts, but we got married 13 years later at 19 - - So you might say, it was a match made in Heaven! Our 40th Anniversary comes September Wandering and Wondering

content: Some girl at my brothers bar had a crush on me. So she brought her freind to make sure she approved. A Long haired blonde knockout, so I started dateing her, she was a few months shy of 18, I was going on 24. She wouldn't allow me to pick her up so i'd send a younger cousin. Her mother found out an forbid me to date her daughter wrong move on her part. After 23 yrs of marriage, I shoullda listened to her mother.
